hints.content: There is an $0$ in the hundreds place.  This means we will round *down* to the nearest thousand.

Which of the following numbers rounds down to $394{,}000$?

[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: A number line with tick marks at 393,000, 394,000, 395,000, and 396,000. The tick mark for 394,000 is green. A blue dot slightly to the right of the 393,000 tick mark is labeled 393,077. A second blue dot slightly to the right of 394,000 is labeled 394,077. A third blue dot slightly to the right of 395,000 is labeled 395,077. The thousands places in 393,077, 394,077, and 395,077 are blue.

A number line with labeled tick marks at 393,000, 394,000, 395,000, and 396,000. The tick mark for 394,000 is green. A blue dot slightly to the right of 394,000 is labeled 394,077. The thousands place in 394,077 is blue.

hints.content:
The following number could replace the $\square$:

- $\blueD4$

question.content:
**Which of the following digits could replace the $\square$ in the thousands place to make this statement true?**

$39\square{,}077$ rounds to $394{,}000$ if we round to the nearest thousand.

[[☃ radio 1]]
